Meet the FloridaRAMA Team
Liz Dimmitt
Founder & CEO
Liz is founder and the curator at large at FloridaRAMA. She oversees the company’s operations and ensures we stay focused on our mission and vision. She has leadership experience in immersive art, cultural strategy and private equity. She holds a BA in Finance from Georgetown University and a MA in Art Business from NYU.  She is an active participant in NYC’s and Tampa Bay’s cultural communities and was born and raised in Dunedin, FL.
Lindsay Collore
Business Director
Lindsay joined the FloridaRAMA team in 2020.
With a strong background in finance and administration, as Business Director she plays a key role in driving the company’s growth and operational efficiency, overseeing business strategies, financial planning, and cross-departmental collaboration.
As a Florida native, Lindsay feels right at home immersed in the weird, wacky, wonderful Florida we celebrate here at FloridaRAMA. She is an animal lover, avid reader, thorough researcher, and nail art enthusiast.
Kristin Hemphill
Creative Director
Kristin comes to FloridaRAMA with 25 years of expertise in design and creative project management. She has worked with some of the world’s leading brands overseeing commercial interior design, brand development and environmental implementation. A certified jeweler, artist and creative entrepreneur, Kristin has always had a passion for mixing materials creating unique environments that are as functional as they are beautiful. As FloridaRAMA Creative Director she ensures project goals are met and each immersive space comes together in the most efficient, fun, and creative way possible.
Katelyn Maher
Experience Director
Katelyn is the Experience Director at FloridaRAMA, where she plays a pivotal role in leading and overseeing the entire experience operation. Katelyn’s journey began as an Experience Guide, progressing to Shift Lead and then an Assistant Manager, showcasing her unwavering commitment and exceptional leadership abilities. Her passion for uncovering the hidden narrative woven throughout FloridaRAMA adds a layer of intrigue to the visitor experience. Hailing from Long Island, New York, she holds a BA in Graphic Design and Leadership/Management from Eckerd College
Jarah Adams
Assistant Experience Manager
Jarah is the Assistant Experience Manager at FloridaRAMA. In his role, he works alongside the operations team to provide excellent customer service and create memorable experiences for our guests. A proud local, he was born and raised in St. Petersburg, Florida and earned a BS in Integrated Public Relations and Advertising from the University of South Florida- Tampa.
Emma Murphy
Assistant Retail & Ticketing Manager
Emma is the Assistant Retail and Ticketing Manager at FloridaRAMA In her role, she works alongside the experience and marketing teams to oversee all retail functions and support the experience operation. She is originally from St. Petersburg, Florida and earned an AA from St. Petersburg College.
Sabrina Marcano
Graphic Designer
Sabrina joined FloridaRAMA in 2024 as an intern and quickly became an integral part of the team, transitioning into her role as Graphic Designer. Currently pursuing her Graphic Design degree at USF, Sabrina is responsible for creating eye-catching visual assets and social media posts that amplify FloridaRAMA’s brand and message. Her passion for design is matched by her love for the arts—whether it’s attending musicals, catching live concerts, or finding inspiration in creative spaces.
Sarah Jennifer Hardin
Marketing Expert & Content Creator
Sarah has been an integral part of FloridaRAMA’s story since 2021. Now serving as a freelance marketing consultant, content creator, graphic designer, and the official spokesperson for FloridaRAMA, she continues to shape the organization’s voice and visual identity. In her evolving role, Sarah leads content creation, develops branding strategies, and represents the organization through public-facing initiatives and community partnerships. With a strong foundation in journalism from UCF and a passion for immersive storytelling, Sarah brings a creative spark to every project. Originally from St. Cloud, Florida, she’s also an avid adventurer—often found swing dancing, hunting for shark teeth, kayaking, or filming underwater scenes.
John Hernandez
Events & Entertainment Manager
John is a dynamic entertainment savant with a strong foundation in nightlife, hospitality, and event promotion. In his dual role, he oversees the planning and execution of FloridaRAMA’s diverse event lineup while also curating engaging entertainment experiences at The Factory St. Pete. His drive comes from a desire to enrich the local community—he relishes the opportunity to bring people together in vibrant, meaningful ways. Beyond his work at FloridaRAMA, John is a dedicated style consultant and music producer who thrives on creativity and connection. With an “extroverted introvert” personality, he comfortably balances the spotlight with moments of quiet reflection that fuel his next big idea. His passion for innovative experiences and community building guides everything he does on and off the stage.
Christina Belgin
Events Manager
Christina has been working as a professional event director for more than 20 years and brings her extensive experience to FloridaRAMA. She is known for her exceptional logistical skills and the ability to plan and execute well-organized events that are tailored to meet the client’s needs. Christina has a unique talent for bringing people together and creating unforgettable experiences, whether it’s a small wedding, film festival, or large convention. Her work has been featured in publications such as The Knot, and she was recognized by Grace Ormonde Weddings as an upcoming planner. When she’s not working, Christina enjoys spending time with her family, cooking, and watching football.
Atlas Singleton
Exhibit Technician
Atlas joins the FloridaRAMA team with 5 years of experience working in technical theatre as well as immersive special events and various audio/visual and scenic construction roles. In his role, Atlas works to incorporate new exhibits and ensures that existing art is maintained. When not working at FloridaRAMA, you can find Atlas building and repairing his collection of retro technology and video game consoles & peripherals, supporting local drag artists across Florida and working with various LGBT activist groups. Atlas is almost entirely self-taught in his craft and is excited to learn and grow alongside the FloridaRAMA team.
Zach Stafford
Exhibit Technician
Zach Stafford is a skilled Audio-Visual Technician based in Dunedin, Florida, specializing in interactive installations and live event production. With expertise in TouchDesigner and projection mapping, he creates immersive experiences that have earned him collaborations with artists and festivals like Emancipator, Disclosure, and Hulaween. His technical expertise, creativity, and collaborative approach has made him an invaluable asset to our team. From large-scale festivals to community-focused events, Zach consistently delivers innovative solutions and seamless technical execution, bringing passion and precision to every project.
Dorse
Vibe Setter
FloridaRAMA’s one-of-a-kind, half-duck, half-horse dynamo who keeps the atmosphere weird, wacky, and wonderfully unpredictable. With a feathered tail and four hooves, Dorse embodies the best of both worlds—quacking through meetings with flair while galloping through creative brainstorms with unmatched energy.

3 Annual Dual Memberships

A generous bundle to treat your team, clients or partners to an unforgettable creative experience.

Enjoy a guided, insider tour of FloridaRAMA led by our founder and visionary-in-chief.

Make your next private event stand out in one of the most imaginative spaces in Florida.

Celebrate your company’s support with visible thanks across our space and programming.
Spotlight in Our Member E-Newsletter
Reach our creative community with a feature highlighting your business and partnership.

Private Events at
Experience Tampa Bay's Most Unique & Memorable Events Venue
Inquire Now
Weddings
kids Birthdays
Looking for an extraordinary experience, creative and fun destination to host an event in St. Petersburg?
FloridaRAMA is not your typical museum – it’s an immersive art experience blending contemporary art, digital interactions, retro Florida, and good vibes
Art for All, Play for All, Joy for All
Venue Highlights:
Accommodates up to 500 guests
Private areas available for smaller groups and meetings
Brag-worthy events include:
Corporate dinners
Weddings
Bat/Bar mitzvahs
Holiday parties
Social gatherings
Fundraisers
Team building
Full-Service Event Planning:
Inclusive packages with creative design, catering, bar services, entertainment, team building, A/V, scavenger games, and décor
Partnership with top local vendors for meticulous detail and seamless execution
Our Promise:
Experienced and caring team to perfect your special occasion
If you can imagine it, we can create it
Inquire Now
Rental Spaces
FloridaRAMA Full Experience
15,000 sq ft created in collaboration with 80+ artists using a variety of media including design, video, sound, light, sculpture and painting. FloridaRAMA is an extraordinary world celebrating all things Florida.
Reception (500)
Sit Down (275)
Mermaid Star Motel Pool
A 1950-1960s style roadside Florida motel. The motel is near open space, including a river of grass and freshwater springs. The Mermaid Star’s spring-fed swimming pool has magic water with special restorative powers.
Reception (50)
Sit Down (30)
The p
ART
y Room
Originally a science lab work space, now changed into an imaginative private room. The perfect space for networking events, rehearsal dinners, children’s parties, boardroom meetings, craft classroom, book club and more. The room can be used on its own or will access to the FloridaRAMA experience.
​
Reception (45)
Sit Down (35)
Inquire Now
Event Rental FAQ
​
​Is FloridaRAMA open during an event?
A FloridaRAMA buyout offers a complete private event throughout the entire experience. The Mermaid Star Motel Pool is a semi-private area and reserved for an event with the rest of the FloridaRAMA experience open for visitors. The pARTy room is a private room alongside the experience.
Do you provide event planning services?
Yes, we offer event coordination and planning services to help you organize every detail, including décor, entertainment, catering and swag. Ask about our packages!
Is there parking available?
Yes, we have ample free parking on-site. We also offer valet services for larger events. Public transport options are nearby for added convenience.
Can we bring our own food or caterer?
We partner with our approved preferred caterers to assist with menu services. Ask our events team for further details.
Do you offer bar services?
Yes, we offer beer & wine packages to top-shelf full bar services and everything in between, including custom drink packages. We can accommodate specific requests. No outside beverages are permitted.
​
Is your venue accessible for guests with disabilities?
Yes, our venue is fully ADAA accessible, including ramps and accessible restrooms.
What clients are saying:
"No better fun and inspiring venue in the St. Pete area to throw a party. My 50th birthday was a blast!! I loved how the events team took care of everything."
- Kathy B.
Nov 2024
"Just a wonderful space for an amazing party.  We had the best time! Every detail was perfect and memorable."
- Rachel W.
Feb 2025
"After being in meetings all day, I was looking forward to a fun unique space to unwind and mingle with my team. FloridaRAMA was a great choice for a creative and comfortable venue for my company's off site dinner."
- Matt S.
March 2025

Mermaid Star Motel Pool

y Room
Originally a science lab work space, now changed into an imaginative private room. The perfect space for networking events, rehearsal dinners, children’s parties, boardroom meetings, craft classroom, book club and more. The room can be used on its own or will access to the FloridaRAMA experience.

Event Rental FAQ
​
​Is FloridaRAMA open during an event?
A FloridaRAMA buyout offers a complete private event throughout the entire experience. The Mermaid Star Motel Pool is a semi-private area and reserved for an event with the rest of the FloridaRAMA experience open for visitors. The pARTy room is a private room alongside the experience.
Do you provide event planning services?
Yes, we offer event coordination and planning services to help you organize every detail, including décor, entertainment, catering and swag. Ask about our packages!
Is there parking available?
Yes, we have ample free parking on-site. We also offer valet services for larger events. Public transport options are nearby for added convenience.
Can we bring our own food or caterer?
We partner with our approved preferred caterers to assist with menu services. Ask our events team for further details.
Do you offer bar services?
Yes, we offer beer & wine packages to top-shelf full bar services and everything in between, including custom drink packages. We can accommodate specific requests. No outside beverages are permitted.
​
Is your venue accessible for guests with disabilities?
Yes, our venue is fully ADAA accessible, including ramps and accessible restrooms.

About FloridaRAMA
Cooler than a museum, smarter than a theme park, and weirder than a carnival, FloridaRAMA is an immersive art experience located in St. Pete’s Warehouse Arts District. FloridaRAMA features a ticketed, interactive journey through a world created by 80+ artists—most of them local—that celebrates the weird, wacky and wonderful stories of Florida.
​
Part contemporary art museum, part digital playground, part Florida roadside attraction and part escape room, FloridaRAMA blends sound, light, sculpture, scent and storytelling into a vibrant, hands-on experience that invites guests of all ages to explore, touch and play. Unlike traditional museums, FloridaRAMA is made to be inhabited—bringing original Florida stories to life through immersive installations that reward curiosity and spark imagination.
​
Visiting or new to the area? Immerse yourself in the sights, sounds and smells (strawberry, pine, citrus!) of Florida. Locals will find new surprises with every visit—there’s always something fresh to discover at FloridaRAMA.
​
Beyond the immersive experience, guests can enjoy a robust calendar of
events
, a vibrant shop and snack bar and a free art gallery showcasing work from local and regional artists.
​
Looking for a one-of-a-kind venue? FloridaRAMA also serves as Tampa Bay’s most unique event space, ideal for private gatherings, social celebrations and corporate outings alike.
​
Send us an
email
!
​

Our Location
FloridaRAMA is located in St. Pete's Warehouse Arts District, along the Pinellas Bike Trail.
2606 Fairfield Ave S., St. Pete, FL 33712
FloridaRAMA Experience
Escape Reality Inside an Artist-Made World!
Inside the FloridaRAMA Experience, guests explore a extraordinary world created in collaboration with 75+ local and international artists, featuring playful installations celebrating weird, wacky, wonderful Florida.​ Find clues to a mysterious narrative and gamify your experience by adding on an immersive scavenger hunt.
The FloridaRAMA Experience is perfect for date night or a day of family fun!
Get Tickets
Venue Rental Spaces
Plan an Unforgettable Event!
Whether you're planning meetings, team-building activities, weddings, galas or any other special occasion, our versatile venue has the spaces and services to provide the perfect backdrop for an unforgettable event. Elevate your event to new heights with FloridaRAMA's exceptional amenities and unique space options.
Learn More
FloridaRAMA Gallery
New Gallery Shows Every Month!
The FloridaRAMA gallery features uniquely curated selling exhibitions by local and national artists each month.The gallery is free to visit and offers visitors and collectors the opportunity to view and collect work by local artists. Located by the FloridaRAMA cafe and ticketing desk, the gallery is open daily.
